# LAYERS OF ENCRYPTION (name undecided)
Basic chal for now, thinking of ways to make non-trivial. As of now I made a basic sa webpage where script deletes flag (so view source ya disable js), stored it in webarchive, replaced webpage with something like maemories and going back in time. then i took the link, js obfuscated the console log with the link, put it in a tag of json description. planned to use it as what you will see when logged as admin. log in admin by setting isAdmin of a login page to 1.<br>
BTW, Daksh told to implement SQL injection challenge in tat and hide it in a row of the table.<br>
### (NOTE: Daksh suggested to avoid php related stuff as harder to implement, so avoiding that angle for now)
SO as of now the final token to be hidden is:-
<br><br>
eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..gfH-pZgrgm503KJPxzEnn3vS8jOrTj_Fjw0vTF5zBtE


## Update
The challenge is almost ready. It is a flask app with not very trivial level of SQL injection, with errors handled and automatic logouts. The databse is also ready along with schema. The secret to a user is shown on entering. Secret of admin is currently above token.<br>
Note:- Daksh suggested to scrap wayback, so currently my angle for timetravel would be commit history of a github repo. The flag will most likely be in a deleted issue history. Since my original page has images->memories of past as time angle, I will modify the landing page with some nice animations of images.<br>
Flag be something like nite{k33ping_up_w1th_+he_time5}<br><br>
